choices.B: Each file read will be moved to an archive directory after it is successfully processed.
choices.A: The actual source directory will be specified by a property in the composite.xml file.
choices.C: This configuration can be used to create an outbound business service component.
choices.D: This configuration can be used to create an inbound proxy service component.

questions.question_text:
Given the following Oracle File Adapter configuration:
<adapter-config name="ReadPlanBenefit" adapter="File Adapter" wsdlLocation="ReadPlanBenefit.wsdl" xmlns=http://platform.integration.oracle/blocks/adapter/fw/metadata>
<connection-factory location="eis/FileAdapter"/>
<endpoint-interaction portType="SynchRead_ptt" operation=" SynchRead">
<interaction-spec
className="oracle.tip.adapter.file.outbound.FileReadInteraction.Spec">
<property name="DeleteFile" value="false"/>
<property name="PhysicalDirectory" value="/home/plan_benefit"/>
<property name="FileName" value=" plan_benefit.xml"/>
<property name="PhysicalArchiveDirectory" value="/home/plan_benefit/archive/>
</interaction-spec>
</endpoint-interaction>
</adapter-config>
Which two statemnts are true?

discussion.content:
B. Each file read will be moved to an archive directory after it is successfully processed.
C. This configuration can be used to create an outbound business service component.

Selected Answer: A
https://docs.oracle.com/middleware/1212/owsm/OWSMC/owsm-intro.htm#OWSMC4166 indicates OWSM provides web service without any additional coding
A. Oracle Web Service Manager Policy Manager

questions.question_text:
The identity context is opaque to your web service client and web service and you dont need to perform any additional coding or processing in your client or service to support it after you enable identity context propagation.
Which Oracle SOA Suite component directly enables this behavior?

choices.A: Oracle Web Service Manager Policy Manager

choices.C: The invocation is retried for a total of six times every two seconds.
choices.B: The invocation is retried for a total of six times every three seconds.
choices.A: The invocation is retried for a total of two times every two seconds. Fault policy reties are ignored.
choices.D: The fault policy retries occur within the JCA retries. So, two JCA retries are executed two seconds apart. Within each fault policy retry, two JCA retries are

questions.question_text:
Composite X invokes an outbound DB adapter to write data to a database table. You have configured JCA retry at the binding component as follows:
<property name = "jca.retry.count" type="xs:int" many="false" override ="may">2</property>
<property name = "jca.retry.interval" type="xs:int" many="false" override ="may">2</property>
You have also modeled a fault policy to retry the invocation three times in case of remoteFault as follows:
<retryCount>3<retryCount>
<retryInterval>3<retryInterval>
What happens when the database that is being accessed by the above binding component goes down?

discussion.content: D. The fault policy retries occur within the JCA retries. So, two JCA retries are executed two seconds apart. Within each fault policy retry, two JCA retries are

Selected Answer: B
The correct answer is B (check the SOA Suite 12c Certification Exam Study Guide)

Selected Answer: B
From SOA Suite 12c Certification Exam Study Guide
B. only EDI translation and validation, but not transformation

choices.B: only EDI translation and validation, but not transformation
choices.D: defines EDI documents, but does not do translation, validation, or transformation
choices.C: only transformation, but not translation or validation

questions.question_text: What does the Oracle B2B component do for an end-to-end EDI transaction?

A. Add managed servers to the domain configuration to support the Oracle SOA Suite cluster.

questions.question_text:
You want to configure Oracle SOA Suite for Maximum Availability Architecture (MAA).
Which two activities must be completed?

choices.C: Rework the Oracle SOA Suite domain configuration to use appropriate GridLink or multiple data sources.
choices.A: Add managed servers to the domain configuration to support the Oracle SOA Suite cluster.
choices.D: Manually retarget the Oracle SOA Suite deployments to the newly created cluster.
choices.B: Run the Configuration Wizard on each server that will host Oracle SOA Suite managed servers.
